item.title: Melissa add a quote by William Goldman
item.description: "People don't remember me. Really. It's not a paranoid thing; I just have this habit of slipping through memories. It doesn't bother me all that much, except I guess that's a lie; it does. For some reason, I test very high on forgettability." -- William Goldman

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Wake up, you idiots! Whatever made you think that money was so valuable?" -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Beware of the man who works hard to learn something, learns it, and finds himself no wiser than before." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Melissa add a quote by Jennifer Egan
item.description: "Like all failed experiments, that one taught me something I didnâ€™t expect: one key ingredient of so-called experience is the delusional faith that it is unique and special, that those included in it are privileged and those excluded from it are missing out. And I, like a scientist unwittingly inhaling toxic fumes from the beaker I was boiling in my lab, had, through sheer physical proximity, been infected by that same delusion and in my drugged state had come to believe I was Excluded: condemned to stand shivering outside the public library at Fifth Avenue and Forty-second Street forever and..." -- Jennifer Egan
